Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition EHDSProcedure

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
EHDSProcedure 0..*BaseProcedure model
Instances of this logical model can be the target of a Reference
identifier 0..*IdentifierC.16.1 - Identifier
description 0..1stringC.16.2 - Description
code 0..1CodeableConceptC.16.3 - Code
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): SNOMED CT

date[x] 0..1C.16.4 - Date
dateDateTimedateTime
datePeriodPeriod
performer 0..*Reference(Health professional model)C.16.5 - Performer
anatomicLocation 0..*CodeableConceptC.16.6 - Anatomic location
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): SNOMED CT, ICD-O-3


reason 0..*Reference(Condition model | Observation model | Procedure model)C.16.7 - Reason
outcome 0..1CodeableConceptC.16.8 - Outcome
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): SNOMED CT

complication 0..*CodeableConceptC.16.9 - Complication
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): ICD-10*, SNOMED CT, Orphacode if rare disease is diagnosed


deviceUsed 0..*EHDSDeviceC.16.10 - Device used
focalDevice 0..*Reference(Device model)C.16.11 - Focal device
location 0..*EHDSLocationC.16.12 - Location
note 0..1stringC.16.13 - Note
subject 1..1Reference(Patient model | Location model | Device model | Organization model | Health professional model | Group model)C.16.14 - Patient

Documentation for this format

name: EHDSProcedure
title: Procedure model
description: C.16 - EHDS refined base model for An action that is or was performed on or for a patient

element.definition: C.16 - EHDS refined base model for An action that is or was performed on or for a patient
Procedure identifier
Procedure specification in string form
Code identifying the procedure
Date and time of the procedure or interval of its performance
An actor who or what performed the procedure
Anatomic location and laterality where the procedure was performed. This is the target site.
The reason why the procedure was performed.
The outcome of the procedure - did it resolve the reasons for the procedure being performed?

Any complications that occurred during the procedure, or in the immediate post-performance period. These are generally tracked separately from the procedure description, which will typically describe the procedure itself rather than any 'post procedure' issues.

binding.description: ICD-10*, SNOMED CT, Orphacode if rare disease is diagnosed

element.definition: Device used to perform the procedure
Device or devices that is/are implanted, removed, or otherwise manipulated (calibration, battery replacement, fitting a prosthesis, attaching a wound-vac, etc.) as a focal portion of the Procedure.
Location where the procedure had been performed
Additional information about the procedure

On whom or on what the procedure was performed. This is usually an individual human, but can also be performed on animals, groups of humans or animals, organizations or practitioners (for licensing), locations or devices (for safety inspections or regulatory authorizations). If the actual focus of the procedure is different from the subject, the focus element specifies the actual focus of the procedure.
